text: Magnesium formate is a magnesium salt of formic acid. It is an inorganic compound. It consists of a magnesium cation and formate anion. It can be prepared by reacting magnesium oxide with formic acid. The dihydrate is formed when crystallizing from the solution.D.Dollimore, J.P. Gupta, D.V.Nowell. The thermal decomposition of metal formates. II. Solid state thermal decomposition studies on magnesium formate dihydrate. Thermochimica Acta, 1979. 30 (1-2): 339-350. doi: 10.1016/0040-6031(79)85069-8. ==References== Category:Formates Category:Magnesium compounds
title: Magnesium formate
